themes_developed.invisibility_through_pattern: Yusuf spots police trying to blend in because he knows the patterns of his neighborhood. Same skill he uses to evade systems. But his own patterns (coding style) are making him visible to Emil.
themes_developed.data_exhaust_as_weapon: Yusuf plans to weaponize police behavioral data against them. Turning their own patterns into predictions. But also leaving his own data exhaust in code.
themes_developed.human_obsolescence: Algorithmic hiring discrimination shown concretely - people from Rosengård filtered out by resume screening. System creates its own enemies by excluding talent.
themes_developed.systemic_vs_individual: Tech center staff articulates the systemic problem clearly. Doesn't excuse crime but explains it. Sara must enforce law while recognizing system is broken.
themes_developed.teacher_responsibility: Yusuf beginning to grapple with - teachers shape students. Can't claim total innocence. Seeds of his eventual choice to teach police.

emotional_beats.emil_pattern_recognition: Six hours of focused work paying off - the excitement of finding the signature
emotional_beats.sara_community_conversation: Understanding perspective, parallel to father, recognition of systemic injustice

emotional_beats.sara_honesty: Admitting the system is broken but still having duty to enforce law
emotional_beats.yusuf_first_appearance: MAJOR BEAT - reader meets Adversary as real person, sees his small room, his normal life, his strategic mind
emotional_beats.yusuf_moment_of_doubt: The 'Shit' moment - real pressure, real consequences, not just theoretical
emotional_beats.yusuf_commitment: Creating the police prediction project - doubling down, choosing to fight
emotional_beats.mutual_awareness: Sara's final line - 'The hunt was mutual now' - both sides know

tone_notes: Building tension through parallel scenes. Emil's technical detective work is methodical and satisfying. Sara's community investigation is empathetic and complex. Yusuf's POV is strategic and human - he's not a villain, he's a person making choices based on his context. No melodrama. Dry observations (the irony of his logistics job). Winter darkness and small rooms create intimacy and pressure. The mutual awareness at the end raises stakes significantly.
